column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Buy Commercial Notes
#Text=Commercial notes ( also referred to as commercial paper ) are a form of short-term debt issued by corporations to raise money to meet immediate needs .
#Text=This type of debt can have a maturity of as little as 1 day and no more than 270 days .
#Text=Commercial paper is a type of unsecured debt , meaning the lender ( the investor ) has no guaranteed claim on any asset of the issuing company in case of default .
#Text=As a result , the best commercial paper is issued from corporations with outstanding credit ratings .
#Text=Learning how to buy commercial notes will help you increase the breadth of your investment strategy .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Open an account with a brokerage firm .
#Text=Commercial paper is rarely issued directly to individual investors , so you will need to do business with a broker in order to make a purchase .
#Text=You can choose from a full-service brokerage firm or a no-frills online broker ; both will allow you access to commercial notes .
#Text=If you do n't already have an account with a stockbroker , consider avoiding commercial notes for a while .
#Text=This type of debt is unsecured , and thus should n't be used as the foundation of an investment portfolio .
#Text=Before investing in commercial paper , build a strong portfolio with lower-risk investments like government bonds .
#Text=Compare the credit ratings of companies that issue commercial paper .
#Text=Because commercial notes are unsecured , it is important that the issuing company has excellent credit .
#Text=These companies will present a lower risk of default .
#Text=The 2 main companies that issue credit ratings for corporations are Moody 's and Standard and Poor 's .
#Text=Look up the ratings for several large companies ; anything less than an " AAA " rating should be passed over when purchasing commercial notes .
#Text=Compare the interest rates offered by several large companies .
#Text=Once you have decided on several companies that have attractive credit ratings , determine the interest rates they are offering on their commercial notes .
#Text=This information is available online or through your brokerage service .
#Text=Remember , longer maturities tie your money up longer , and therefore need to offer a higher interest rate .
#Text=Issue a " buy " order to your broker .
#Text=Once you have decided to buy a certain company 's commercial paper , issue an order to your broker to buy the paper .

#Text=Minimum investment amounts are often quite hefty for commercial paper - in U.S. dollars , commercial paper cannot usually be had for less than $ 1000 , and often sells at a minimum of $ 100,000 .
#Text=Remember that this type of unsecured investment should not form the foundation of your investment portfolio .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Remember to monitor the financial statements of any company whose commercial paper you purchase .
#Text=Commercial paper should be used to augment working capital , so make sure that the company is not issuing commercial notes to meet long-term obligations .
